text:
“Can this be still a dream?” Raskolnikov thought.

He stared at the unexpected visitor. 

“Svidrigaïlov! What nonsense! It can’t be!” 

Svidrigaïlov smiled. 

“I’ve come for two reasons. First, to meet you. I’ve heard much about you. Second, I need your help for your sister, Avdotya Romanovna.”

Raskolnikov frowned. 

“You reckon wrongly,” he interrupted.

“Did they arrive yesterday?” Svidrigaïlov asked.

Raskolnikov stayed silent.

“It was yesterday, I know. I arrived the day before. 

But tell me, Rodion Romanovitch, was there anything criminal in my actions?”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Svidrigaïlov visits Raskolnikov to seek his support regarding Raskolnikov's sister, Avdotya, despite Raskolnikov's evident distrust.
